basics.name: Emanuel Flores Bautista
basics.label: PhD Candidate
basics.summary: PhD candidate in Biochemistry & Molecular Biophysics with a graduate minor in Applied & Computational Mathematics

work.name: Chan Zuckerberg Biohub
work.summary: Used a geometric model to understand technical effects in single cell transcriptome data. Using this model, we built an analysis pipeline that enabled integrating datasets from different timepoints that were possibly subject to the studied technical effects.

work.name: California Institute of Technology
work.summary: Together with my collaborator, Andy Halleran, we developed a stochastic differential equations model to simulate plasmid partitioning in bacterial cells.

education.area: Biochemistry & Molecular Biophysics with Applied & Computational Math (graduate minor)
education.description:
Dissertation: Topological decomposition of cell state manifolds
Supervisor: Matt Thomson

Dissertation: Functional prediction of unknown transcription factors in E. coli K-12 using RNA-seq data
Supervisor: Ernesto Pérez Rueda
